basics.name: Aleksandar Bošković
basics.label: Mechanical Engineering Student
basics.summary: Undergraduate student at Georgia Institute of Technology pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering. Research focuses on Human–Robot Interaction, Wearable Robotics, Haptics, Surgical Robotics, and Medical Devices.

work.name: Boston Scientific
work.summary: Improved fidelity and speed of a laser ablation system by developing an empirically driven marking file, reducing cycle time by 64% and saving 2300+ annual machine hours. Conducted root-cause analysis on heat-affected zones using SEM; collaborated across teams to increase process robustness.
highlights: Reduced cycle time by 64% and saved 2300+ annual machine hours
Conducted root-cause analysis using SEM
Measured sputtered-ceramic thickness via XRF and ran statistical analysis in Minitab

work.name: Undergraduate Research Ambassadors, Georgia Tech
work.summary: Organized workshops with GT's Office of Undergraduate Education & Student Success to guide students through research opportunities, graduate school preparation, and fellowships.
highlights: Organized workshops for research opportunities and graduate school preparation
Supported research programming by staffing fairs and coordinating lab tours

work.name: ME2110: Creative Decisions and Design, Georgia Tech
work.summary: Supervised labs and coached students on design and construction of robotic systems. Trained students in Arduino-based control and safe rapid-prototyping techniques.
highlights: Supervised labs and coached students on robotic systems
Trained students in Arduino-based control and rapid-prototyping

work.name: Flowers Invention Studio, Georgia Tech
work.summary: Trained students and faculty on safe and effective use of shop tools and rapid prototyping equipment. Supported fabrication across woodworking, metalworking, 3D printing, electronics, and laser cutting.
highlights: Trained students and faculty on shop tools and rapid prototyping
Supported fabrication across multiple manufacturing processes

work.name: Georgia Tech Robotics Summer Institute
work.summary: Helped high school students build autonomous robots and program Arduino-based systems. Moderated a panel advising participants on college admissions and STEM pathways.
highlights: Helped high school students build autonomous robots
Moderated panel on college admissions and STEM pathways

work.name: HyTech Racing
work.summary: Evaluated ergonomic control designs to reduce user error. Designed lightweight harness-mount spacers and custom brake-fluid reservoir fittings.
highlights: Evaluated ergonomic control designs
Designed and machined custom components

projects.name: V6 Robotic Hip Exoskeleton
projects.summary: Designed and manufactured a novel thigh interface with a passive 3-DOF planar mobility mechanism mitigating skin irritation caused by misalignment between hip joint and actuator axes. Used SolidWorks FEA to improve structural design, reducing mass by over 35%.
highlights: Designed passive 3-DOF planar mobility mechanism
Reduced mass by over 35% using FEA optimization
Collected multimodal datasets from able-bodied and stroke-impaired participants
Performed clinical evaluations using Fugl-Meyer Assessment

projects.name: Dynamic Simulation of Hip–Knee Joint Mechanics
projects.summary: Developed a double-pendulum model of human hip and knee dynamics using torsional springs and dampers. Simulated torques for martial-arts kicks, soccer strikes, and rehabilitative cycling.
highlights: Developed double-pendulum model with nonlinear dynamics
Analyzed stability, frequency response, and transient behavior
Compared nonlinear and linear system performance

projects.name: Robotic Dynamometer
projects.summary: Designed a custom motor-driven dynamometer to replace a weight stack, enabling variable-speed and complex loading tests for ankle work-loop platform.
highlights: Designed custom motor-driven dynamometer
Selected motor and gearbox components via MATLAB modeling
Fabricated components using waterjet, drill press, and machining

projects.name: Design and Control of an Autonomous Robot
projects.summary: Programmed an autonomous robot in Arduino integrating IR/ultrasonic sensors with motors, solenoids, and pneumatic actuation. Designed a low-profile scissor lift extending 4.5 ft from a 4-in collapsed height.
highlights: Integrated multiple sensor types with actuators
Designed and machined custom scissor lift mechanism
Built rapid-deploy obstacle clearing mechanism
